description.intro: The Hibiscus is a tropical flowering plant known for its large, colorful blooms that make it a striking addition to any garden.
description.water: Water regularly, keeping the soil moist, especially in hotter months.
description.sunlight: Prefers full sun but can tolerate partial shade.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, most Hibiscus varieties are safe for pets.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Hibiscus is easy to grow with adequate sunlight and water.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil with good sunlight exposure. Water regularly but ensure proper drainage to avoid root rot.

watering.frequency: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, especially in hot weather.

light.description: Full sun is ideal, but partial shade can work well in hotter climates.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Hibiscus?
faqs.answer: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, especially in hot weather, but ensure good drainage.

faqs.question: What light does it need?
faqs.answer: Full sun is ideal, but it can tolerate partial shade in hotter regions.

faqs.question: Is it safe for pets?
faqs.answer: No, Hibiscus is toxic to pets if ingested, so keep it out of reach.

faqs.question: Can Hibiscus be grown in pots?
faqs.answer: Yes, it can be grown in pots as long as they are large enough to accommodate the root system and provide good drainage.

faqs.question: Does Hibiscus bloom year-round?
faqs.answer: No, it typically blooms from summer to fall.

description.intro: Bougainvillea is known for its vibrant, colorful bracts that bloom all year round in tropical climates.
description.water: Water deeply but infrequently once established. Prefers well-draining soil.
description.sunlight: Needs full sun for optimal growth and flowering.
description.pet_friendly: No, Bougainvillea is mildly toxic to pets if ingested.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Bougainvillea is drought-tolerant and low-maintenance once established.

how_to_plant: Plant in a sunny spot with well-draining soil. Ensure good airflow to avoid mildew.

watering.frequency: Water deeply once a week in dry weather.
watering.description: Allow the soil to dry out between waterings.

light.description: Full sun is essential for vigorous flowering.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 2 weeks during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.

temperature.description: Prefers warm weather and can tolerate heat.

humidity.description: No special humidity needs, but thrives in tropical climates.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Bougainvillea?
faqs.answer: Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.

faqs.question: Does it need full sun?
faqs.answer: Yes, Bougainvillea thrives in full sun for best flowering.

faqs.question: Is it safe for pets?
faqs.answer: No, Bougainvillea is toxic to pets if ingested.

faqs.question: Can I grow Bougainvillea in a pot?
faqs.answer: Yes, it can be grown in a pot as long as the pot has proper drainage.

faqs.question: Does Bougainvillea flower all year?
faqs.answer: Yes, it can flower year-round in tropical climates.

description.intro: Marigolds are popular annual flowers known for their vibrant colors and easy care, making them great for any garden.
description.water: Water regularly, but do not overwater. Let the soil dry slightly between watering.
description.sunlight: Full sun is ideal for Marigolds.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Marigolds are generally safe for pets, though ingestion may cause mild stomach upset.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Marigolds are hardy annuals and very easy to grow.

how_to_plant: Plant in a sunny area with well-draining soil. Space plants 8-12 inches apart.

watering.frequency: Water regularly, especially during dry spells.
watering.description: Water thoroughly, but allow soil to dry out slightly between watering.

light.description: Full sun is essential for optimal growth and flowering.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 4 weeks during the growing season.

temperature.description: Prefers warm temperatures and can tolerate heat.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Marigold?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, but allow the soil to dry slightly between waterings.

faqs.question: Does Marigold need full sun?
faqs.answer: Yes, Marigolds thrive in full sun.

faqs.question: Are Marigolds pet-friendly?
faqs.answer: Yes, Marigolds are non-toxic to pets.

faqs.question: When does Marigold flower?
faqs.answer: Marigolds flower from spring to fall, depending on the climate.

faqs.question: How do I care for my Marigold?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, ensure well-draining soil, and provide full sun for optimal growth.

description.intro: Roses are classic flowering plants known for their beautiful, fragrant blooms, and they come in a wide range of colors.
description.water: Water deeply but infrequently once established. Roses prefer moist but well-draining soil.
description.sunlight: Roses need full sun to bloom well.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Roses are non-toxic to pets, though thorns can be a physical hazard.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, with basic care, Roses are manageable for beginners.

how_to_plant: Plant in a sunny spot with well-draining soil. Prune dead wood regularly to encourage new growth.

watering.frequency: Water deeply once a week, more frequently during hot weather.
watering.description: Water at the base of the plant to avoid wetting the leaves, which can encourage disease.

light.description: Full sun is essential for optimal growth and flowering.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize monthly during the growing season with a specialized rose fertilizer.

humidity.description: Roses are tolerant of average humidity levels.

toxicity: Some varieties are toxic to pets

faqs.question: How often should I water my Rose?
faqs.answer: Water deeply once a week, and more frequently during hot spells.

faqs.question: What light does a Rose need?
faqs.answer: Roses require full sun for optimal blooming.

faqs.question: Are Roses safe for pets?
faqs.answer: Some varieties may be toxic to pets, and they also have thorns.

faqs.question: How do I care for my Rose bush?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, ensure good drainage, prune regularly, and fertilize during the growing season.

faqs.question: When do Roses bloom?
faqs.answer: Roses typically bloom from spring to fall.

description.intro: Lantanas are known for their bright, multi-colored clusters of flowers that attract butterflies and hummingbirds.
description.water: Water regularly, but avoid overwatering. Let the soil dry slightly between waterings.
description.pet_friendly: No, Lantana is highly toxic to pets and humans if ingested.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Lantana is hardy and thrives in sunny conditions, making it easy for beginners.

how_to_plant: Plant in a sunny spot with well-draining soil. Space plants 12 inches apart.

watering.frequency: Water when the soil feels dry to the touch.
watering.description: Avoid waterlogging. Lantanas prefer slightly drier conditions.

light.description: Full sun is ideal for vigorous growth and abundant flowers.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 4-6 weeks during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.

temperature.description: Prefers warm temperatures and can tolerate heat.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Lantana?
faqs.answer: Water when the soil feels dry to the touch, but avoid overwatering.

faqs.question: Does Lantana need full sun?
faqs.answer: Yes, Lantanas thrive in full sun.

faqs.question: Is Lantana pet-friendly?
faqs.answer: No, Lantana is toxic to pets if ingested.

faqs.question: How do I care for Lantana?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, provide full sun, and prune spent flowers to encourage new growth.

faqs.question: When does Lantana flower?
faqs.answer: Lantanas flower from spring to fall, attracting pollinators.

description.intro: Ixora is a tropical shrub known for its bright clusters of small flowers that attract butterflies.
description.water: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, but not soggy.
description.sunlight: Ixoras thrive in partial to full sun.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, Ixora is generally non-toxic to pets.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Ixora is easy to maintain with sunlight and regular watering.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil with partial or full sun exposure. Space 2-3 feet apart.

watering.frequency: Water regularly to keep the soil moist.
watering.description: Do not allow the soil to dry out completely.

light.description: Ixora plants prefer partial to full sun.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 4-6 weeks with a balanced fertilizer during the growing season.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Ixora?
faqs.answer: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, but avoid waterlogging.

faqs.question: What light does Ixora need?
faqs.answer: Ixora plants thrive in partial to full sun.

faqs.question: Is Ixora safe for pets?
faqs.answer: No, Ixora is toxic to pets if ingested.

faqs.question: How do I care for Ixora?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, provide full sun, and fertilize every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.

faqs.question: When does Ixora flower?
faqs.answer: Ixora flowers year-round, with peak blooming in warmer months.

description.intro: Jasmine is a fragrant flowering plant known for its small, white or yellow flowers that are often used in perfumes.
description.water: Water regularly, keeping the soil moist but not soggy.
description.sunlight: Prefers full sun to partial shade.
description.pet_friendly: Yes, true Jasmine is safe for pets (note: some false Jasmines are toxic).
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Jasmine is easy to grow in warm climates and good for beginners.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil with full sun to partial shade exposure. Space 2 feet apart for vines.

watering.frequency: Water regularly, but allow the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
watering.description: Ensure good drainage to avoid waterlogging.

light.description: Prefers full sun but can tolerate partial shade.

fertilizer.description: Feed once every 4-6 weeks with a balanced fertilizer during the growing season.

benefits: Attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies

faqs.question: How often should I water my Jasmine?
faqs.answer: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, but avoid waterlogging.

faqs.question: Does Jasmine need full sun?
faqs.answer: Jasmine prefers full sun to partial shade for optimal flowering.

faqs.question: Is Jasmine safe for pets?
faqs.answer: No, Jasmine is toxic to pets if ingested.

faqs.question: How do I care for Jasmine?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, provide full sun, and feed with a balanced fertilizer during the growing season.

faqs.question: When does Jasmine flower?
faqs.answer: Jasmine flowers from spring to fall, releasing its fragrant aroma.

description.intro: Plumeria is known for its beautiful and fragrant flowers, commonly used in Hawaiian leis.
description.water: Water regularly, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
description.pet_friendly: No, Plumeria is toxic to pets if ingested.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Plumeria is easy to care for in warm, sunny climates.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil with full sun exposure. Space 2-3 feet apart for adequate growth.

watering.frequency: Water regularly, but let the soil dry slightly between waterings.
watering.description: Ensure the soil drains well to avoid root rot.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 4-6 weeks during the growing season with a balanced fertilizer.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Plumeria?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, but allow the soil to dry slightly between waterings.

faqs.question: Does Plumeria need full sun?
faqs.answer: Yes, Plumeria thrives in full sun.

faqs.question: Is Plumeria safe for pets?
faqs.answer: No, Plumeria is toxic to pets if ingested.

faqs.question: How do I care for Plumeria?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, provide full sun, and feed with a balanced fertilizer during the growing season.

faqs.question: When does Plumeria flower?
faqs.answer: Plumeria flowers from spring to fall, producing fragrant blooms.

images.alt_text: Lemon and lime citrus fruits on tree
Citrus tree with ripe lemons and limes

description.intro: Citrus trees produce fragrant flowers and delicious fruit, including lemons, limes, and oranges.
description.water: Water regularly, ensuring soil is consistently moist but not soggy.
description.pet_friendly: No, citrus leaves and peels can be toxic to pets.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, with proper sun and drainage, citrus trees are manageable for beginners.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil with full sun exposure. Space 4 feet apart for adequate growth.

watering.frequency: Water regularly, but ensure soil drains well to avoid root rot.
watering.description: Ensure proper drainage and water when soil is dry to the touch.

light.description: Citrus trees require full sun to thrive.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 4-6 weeks with a balanced citrus fertilizer during the growing season.

humidity.description: Citrus trees thrive in moderate humidity.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Citrus tree?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, ensuring soil is consistently moist but not soggy.

faqs.question: What light does my Citrus tree need?
faqs.answer: Citrus trees require full sun to produce fruit and thrive.

faqs.question: Are Citrus trees safe for pets?
faqs.answer: Yes, Citrus trees are non-toxic to pets.

faqs.question: How do I care for my Citrus tree?
faqs.answer: Water regularly, provide full sun, and fertilize every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.

faqs.question: When do Citrus trees bear fruit?
faqs.answer: Citrus trees typically bear fruit in late spring to early summer.

images.alt_text: Croton plant with vibrant colored leaves

description.intro: Croton is a tropical plant known for its colorful, variegated foliage in hues of red, yellow, and green.
description.water: Water regularly, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
description.pet_friendly: No, Croton is toxic to pets and can cause irritation if ingested.
description.beginner_friendly: Yes, Croton is low-maintenance and suitable for beginners familiar with outdoor gardening.

how_to_plant: Plant in well-draining soil and provide partial to full sun. Space plants 18 inches apart for best growth.

watering.frequency: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
watering.description: Avoid waterlogging and ensure proper drainage.

fertilizer.description: Fertilize every 4-6 weeks with a balanced, water-soluble fertilizer during the growing season.

faqs.question: How often should I water my Croton?
faqs.answer: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.

faqs.question: Does Croton need full sun?
faqs.answer: Croton prefers bright, indirect sunlight but can tolerate some direct sunlight.

faqs.question: Is Croton safe for pets?
faqs.answer: No, Croton is toxic to pets if ingested.

faqs.question: How do I care for Croton?
faqs.answer: Water when the soil is dry, provide bright, indirect light, and fertilize regularly during the growing season.

faqs.question: Does Croton flower?
faqs.answer: Croton is grown for its colorful foliage rather than its flowers.
